last_episode_to_air.name: Dekalog: Ten
last_episode_to_air.overview: “Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s goods.” Especially not when it leads to the conclusion of this black comedy about two brothers who inherit their father’s valuable stamp collection and end up paying rather more than they bargained for…

name: Dekalog
overview: Originally made for Polish television, “The Decalogue” focuses on the residents of a housing complex in late-Communist Poland, whose lives become subtly intertwined as they face emotional dilemmas that are at once deeply personal and universally human. Its ten hour-long films, drawing from the Ten Commandments for thematic inspiration and an overarching structure, grapple deftly with complex moral and existential questions concerning life, death, love, hate, truth, and the passage of time.

seasons.name: Dekalog
seasons.overview: Originally made for Polish television, “The Decalogue” focuses on the residents of a housing complex in late-Communist Poland, whose lives become subtly intertwined as they face emotional dilemmas that are at once deeply personal and universally human. Its ten hour-long films, drawing from the Ten Commandments for thematic inspiration and an overarching structure, grapple deftly with complex moral and existential questions concerning life, death, love, hate, truth, and the passage of time.

episodes.name: Dekalog: One
episodes.overview: “I am the Lord thy God; thou shalt have no other God but me.” Ten-year-old Pawel and his father Krzysztof run their lives on their beloved home computer, while Pawel’s aunt worries that his spiritual education is being neglected. But Pawel is too busy enjoying life, not least thanks to his father’s Christmas present of a pair of ice skates, because the computer has calculated that the frozen lake is safe to skate across…

guest_stars.character: ojciec Jacka; w napisach podane nazwisko: Bormiński
guest_stars.name: Maciej Borniński

guest_stars.character: Ania, koleżanka Krzysztofa ucząca Pawła języka angielskiego
guest_stars.name: Maria Gładkowska

guest_stars.character: Ewa Jezierska, matka Marka, kolegi Pawła
guest_stars.name: Ewa Kania

guest_stars.character: dziennikarka przeprowadzająca wywiad z dyrektorem szkoły
guest_stars.name: Magda Sroga-Mikołajczyk

episodes.name: Dekalog: Two
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain.” An elderly doctor is approached by a woman with a complicated request. Her husband is gravely ill and may die, and she is pregnant by someone else. If her husband dies, she wants to keep the child, but not otherwise, and she wants the doctor to give him an honest verdict on his chances. But the doctor is disturbed by her request, because his answer will directly affect the life or death of another human being. Is he entitled to play God?

guest_stars.character: kochanek Doroty; tylko głos; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Piotr Fronczewski

episodes.name: Dekalog: Three
episodes.overview: “Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.” Janusz is a taxi driver. It’s Christmas Eve, and he honours the (Polish) traditions for this (holy) day: he gives presents to the members of his family and attends Midnight Mass. Later, Ewa, a woman who he had betrayed his wife with three years earlier, asks him to help her. Her husband is missing, and she asks him to help her search for him. Should Janusz stay home to keep the day holy? Or should he help Ewa, who says she needs his help, to keep the day holy? Is it his duty to help her? This episode seems to be about both…

guest_stars.character: Edward Garus, były kochanek Ewy; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Edward Kłosiński

episodes.name: Dekalog: Four
episodes.overview: “Honour thy father and thy mother.” Young Anka and her father have lived together since her mother’s death, and have always been more like close friends than father and daughter. One day, Anka discovers a letter from her mother whose contents make her question her whole relationship with her father… if that’s indeed who he is.

guest_stars.character: profesor w szkole teatralnej, wykładowca Anki
guest_stars.name: Adam Hanuszkiewicz

guest_stars.character: student szkoły teatralnej; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Andrzej Chyra

episodes.name: Dekalog: Five
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not kill.” A shorter, slightly less graphic version of “A Short Film About Killing,” but the plot is essentially the same: murder followed by execution, two killings, one illegal, one legal, both hideous.

guest_stars.character: staruszka karmiąca gołębie pod Kolumną Zygmunta
guest_stars.name: Helena Kowalczykowa

guest_stars.character: kumpel pijanego na postoju taksówek; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Leonard Andrzejewski

guest_stars.character: członek komisji adwokackiej; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Henryk Łapiński

episodes.name: Dekalog: Six
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not commit adultery.” A shorter, scaled-down version of “A Short Film About Love,” with a less complex plot and a different ending—though the basic narrative about the relationship between a lonely 19-year-old boy and the thirty-something artist that he spies on every night is the same.

guest_stars.character: kierowniczka sklepu; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Anna Lenartowicz

guest_stars.character: ekspedientka w sklepie; nie występuje w napisach
guest_stars.name: Jarosława Michalewska

episodes.name: Dekalog: Seven
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not steal.” But in this case the “theft” is of a child by her real mother, who then finds herself emotionally unable to cope with the responsibility, while the stable and loving family that brought the child up are distraught.

guest_stars.character: woźna w Pałacu Kultury i Nauki
guest_stars.name: Stefania Błońska

guest_stars.character: bileterka na przedstawieniu w Pałacu Kultury i Nauki
guest_stars.name: Ewa Radzikowska

episodes.name: Dekalog: Eight
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.” A Polish-American researcher visits Warsaw and attends a lecture about ethics. Afterwards, she approaches Zofia, the lecturer, and says that she is the little Jewish girl whom Zofia refused to shelter during World War II. But Zofia has a very good reason for her apparent cowardice…

guest_stars.character: student wypowiadający się na wykładzie Zofii
guest_stars.name: Wojciech Asiński

guest_stars.character: studentka opowiadająca historię Doroty (z części drugiej)
guest_stars.name: Ewa Skibińska

guest_stars.character: studentka wypowiadająca się na wykładzie Zofii
guest_stars.name: Anna Zagórska

episodes.name: Dekalog: Nine
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s wife.” Roman, after discovering his impotence, urges his wife Hanka to take a lover. She reluctantly complies, and Roman, despite his earlier words, becomes obsessively jealous. Spying on her, he learns of her affair, and vows to kill himself—not knowing that Hanka was in fact breaking off the relationship…

episodes.name: Dekalog: Ten
episodes.overview: “Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour’s goods.” Especially not when it leads to the conclusion of this black comedy about two brothers who inherit their father’s valuable stamp collection and end up paying rather more than they bargained for…

guest_stars.character: handlarz pod sklepem filatelistycznym na Świętokrzyskiej
guest_stars.name: Daniel Kozakiewicz
